channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Opendoor brings back its founders plus a new CEO from Shopify—who could earn $2.8 billion if he sends the stock soaring
item.description: If Kaz Netjatian can clear all the performance hurdles in his compensation package, he’ll own 11.6% of the tech company.

item.title: Why the founder CEO of $22 billion Ramp tracks every single day his unicorn startup has been in existence
item.description: Two thousand three hundred and sixty-seven days. Exactly.

item.title: Dow closes over 46K for first time, joins S&P and Nasdaq in booking new records
Adobe’s stock has fallen after its last four earnings. Can AI finally deliver?
Figure's IPO sizzles as investors stay hungry for crypto deals
Adobe’s stock rises as earnings beat shows that AI is finally paying off
Stocks and bonds are sending very different messages about recession risks
$16 billion Twilio CEO wakes at 4:30 a.m., works Sundays and runs laps around his house between meetings to blow off steam
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Running a $16 billion company looks like 4:30 a.m. starts, working on Sundays and running laps around the house to blow off steam—and Twili...

item.title: Third Space’s CEO follows an 80/20 rule for eating out, competes in triathlons at 54-years-old and made startup investments he regrets
item.description: Third Space CEO’s worst investment? “A handful of startups that have gone bust…”

item.title: Step aside, LinkedIn: Grindr CEO says he has hired workers through the dating app, as the company pitches itself as the new networking platform in town
item.description: Users checking into the dating app to see how many feet they are from a potential love interest can now expect to be poached, rather than asked out.
